snippet: Inhibited sexual desire (ISD) refers to a low level of sexual interest. A person with ISD will not start, or respond to their partner's desire for, sexual activity. ISD can be primary (in which the person has never felt much sexual desire or inter...
lead_paragraph: Inhibited sexual desire (ISD) refers to a low level of sexual interest. A person with ISD will not start, or respond to their partner's desire for, sexual activity. ISD can be primary (in which the person has never felt much sexual desire or interest), or secondary (in which the person used to feel sexual desire, but no longer does). ISD can also relate to the partner (the person with ISD is interested in other people, but not his or her partner), or it can be general ( the person with ISD isn't sexually interested in anyone). In the extreme form of sexual aversion, the person not only lacks sexual desire, but may find sex repulsive. Sometimes, the sexual desire is not inhibited. The two partners have different sexual interest levels, even though both of their interest levels are within the normal range. Someone can claim that his or her partner has ISD, when in fact they have overactive sexual desire and are very demanding sexually.

headline.main: Inhibited Sexual Desire

snippet: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and god...
lead_paragraph: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and goddess, Hermes and Aphrodite. Hermes was a god of male sexuality (among other things) and Aphrodite a goddess of female sexuality, love, and beauty. Although the older terms are still included in this article for reference, they have been replaced by most experts (and patients and families) because they are misleading, confusing, and insensitive. Increasingly this group of conditions is being called disorders of sex development (DSDs).

headline.main: Intersex

snippet: An erection problem occurs when a man can't get or keep an erection that is firm enough for intercourse. You may not be able to get an erection at all. Or, you may lose the erection during intercourse before you are ready. Erection problems usuall...
lead_paragraph: An erection problem occurs when a man can't get or keep an erection that is firm enough for intercourse. You may not be able to get an erection at all. Or, you may lose the erection during intercourse before you are ready. Erection problems usually don't affect your sex drive. Erection problems are common. Almost all adult men have trouble getting or keeping an erection at one time or another. Often the problem goes away with little or no treatment. But for some men, it can be an ongoing problem. This is called erectile dysfunction (ED). If you have trouble getting or keeping an erection more than 25% of the time, you should see your doctor.

headline.main: Erection Problems

snippet: Infertility means you cannot make a baby (conceive). Infertility is grouped into two categories: Primary infertility refers to couples who have not become pregnant after at least 1 year of unprotected sex (intercourse). Secondary infertility refer...

Infertility is grouped into two categories: Primary infertility refers to couples who have not become pregnant after at least 1 year of unprotected sex (intercourse). Secondary infertility refers to couples who have been pregnant at least once, but are not able to get pregnant now.

headline.main: Infertility

snippet: The Air Force said it had punished 21 male cadets for rape and other sex-related crimes since 1990, offering the numbers as evidence that it takes sexual misconduct at the Air Force Academy seriously. Of the 21, 5 received jail time, 8 were expell...
lead_paragraph: The Air Force said it had punished 21 male cadets for rape and other sex-related crimes since 1990, offering the numbers as evidence that it takes sexual misconduct at the Air Force Academy seriously. Of the 21, 5 received jail time, 8 were expelled and 8 were reprimanded, the Air Force said. One was exonerated, and one still faces charges. The academy has been rocked by a sexual assault scandal since some women said they had been reprimanded for reporting that they had been raped by classmates.
abstract: Air Force, offering evidence that it takes sexual misconduct at Air Force Academy seriously, reports it has punished 21 male cadets for rape and other sex-related crimes since 1990 (S)

headline.main: National Briefing | Rockies: Colorado: Cadet Punishments For Abuse

snippet: People who do not identify with the sex they were born into are lobbying Rutgers University for protection against discrimination and harassment, The Associated Press reported yesterday.    Rutgers has forbidden discrimination on the basis of sex ...
lead_paragraph: People who do not identify with the sex they were born into are lobbying Rutgers University for protection against discrimination and harassment, The Associated Press reported yesterday. Rutgers has forbidden discrimination on the basis of sex and sexual orientation since 1981. But members of the school's ''transgendered'' community, which includes transsexuals and transvestites, want explicit protection. ''This isn't about my sexual orientation,'' said Ben Singer, a female-to-male transsexual graduate student. ''It's about my gender identity.''
abstract: People who do not identify with sex they were born into are lobbying Rutgers University for protection against discrimination and harassment; Rutgers has forbidden discrimination on basis of sex and sexual orientation since 1981, but members of school's 'transgendered' community, which includes transsexuals and transvestites, want explicit protection (S) (New Jersey Daily Briefing)

headline.main: Plea for the 'Transgendered'

snippet: The Supreme Court is divided over many issues these days, but sexual harassment is not one of them.     In a series of unanimous decisions beginning in 1986, the Justices have essentially created the law of sexual harassment in the workplace, decl...
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is divided over many issues these days, but sexual harassment is not one of them. In a series of unanimous decisions beginning in 1986, the Justices have essentially created the law of sexual harassment in the workplace, declaring it to be a form of employment discrimination that violates Federal civil rights law. In the latest such opinion -- all of seven pages long -- they expanded workplace protection further, ruling that the same rules apply to harassment among people of the same sex.

headline.main: March 1-7; Workplace Protection Widens In Sexual Harassment

snippet: Essex, Passaic and Camden Counties lead the state in the number of registered sex offenders with 2,317 of the total 7,605 registered under the state's sexual predators act, known as Megan's Law, from the time it was passed in November 1994 through...
lead_paragraph: Essex, Passaic and Camden Counties lead the state in the number of registered sex offenders with 2,317 of the total 7,605 registered under the state's sexual predators act, known as Megan's Law, from the time it was passed in November 1994 through last February, according to a report released last week by the Administrative Office of the Courts. The law requires released sexual offenders to register with the police and allows notification of neighbors, schools and community groups. Of those registered, 98 percent are male; 49 percent are white, 34 percent black and 11 percent Hispanic. Karen DeMasters
abstract: New Jersey Administrative Office of Courts issues report showing that Essex, Passaic and Camden counties lead state in number of sex offenders registered under Megan's Law (S)

snippet: A critic's notebook article on Monday about an academic conference at the University of Chicago on the television show ''Jersey Shore'' referred imprecisely to a comment made by Candace Moore, an assistant professor at the University of Michigan w...
lead_paragraph: A critic's notebook article on Monday about an academic conference at the University of Chicago on the television show ''Jersey Shore'' referred imprecisely to a comment made by Candace Moore, an assistant professor at the University of Michigan who spoke about the friendship between Vinny and Pauly D. She linked the quest for ''stranger sex'' by men on the show to ''some queer and kink cultures,'' not specifically to gay male sexual culture.

headline.main: Corrections

snippet: To the Editor:    Anna Simons (Op-Ed, April 23) argues that because male soldiers bond by discussing sex, women should be prohibited from military combat units. Yet she ignores the consequences of this basis for military bonding. What does it mean...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Anna Simons (Op-Ed, April 23) argues that because male soldiers bond by discussing sex, women should be prohibited from military combat units. Yet she ignores the consequences of this basis for military bonding. What does it mean that the soldier's identity is sexualized? Ask the women of the former Yugoslavia, where rape has been perpetrated as a weapon of war. Ask the female soldiers who have experienced sexual harassment from their colleagues. SANDRA PARK Cambridge, Mass., April 24, 1997
abstract: Sandra Park letter objects to Anna Simons' April 23 Op-Ed article defending male-only combat units on grounds that men bond by discussing sex; says such attitudes lead to sexual harassment and abuse of women (S)

headline.main: Male Soldiers' Identity

snippet: To the Editor:    ''Early Sex Abuse Hinders Many Women on Welfare'' (front page, Nov. 28) reveals the long-term societal costs of this problem, but disregards the many men who are predisposed to become welfare recipients, not to mention sexual abu...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Early Sex Abuse Hinders Many Women on Welfare'' (front page, Nov. 28) reveals the long-term societal costs of this problem, but disregards the many men who are predisposed to become welfare recipients, not to mention sexual abusers, because of the same traumatic childhood experience. Our society's double standard of ignoring or de-emphasizing the male victims of this crime perpetuates the abuse of women and children. DANIEL COBEN East Brunswick, N.J., Nov. 28, 1999
abstract: Daniel Coben letter on November 28 article about how early sex abuse hinders many women on welfare; notes that many men are also predisposed to become welfare dependent, not to mention sexual abusers, because of same traumatic childhood experiences (S)

headline.main: Early Abuse, and a Life of Pain

lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Jan. 10--Experts from 15 countries brought together by the World Health Organization recommend that sexual health care be designed for the "enhancement of life and personal relationships" and ...
abstract: WHO panel of experts from 15 countries, meeting in Geneva, recommends that sexual health care be designed for 'enhancement of life and personal relationships' and not just for dealing with 'procreation or sexually transmitted diseases'; says sexual taboos and myths and resulting guilt or secrecy imposed by soc on sexual matters are important obstacles to sex educ; decries cult of male dominance over and victimization of women that makes it difficult to introduce idea of sexual enjoyment for both partners; US participants include Drs Helen S Kaplan, Paul H Gebhard and Harold I Lief; several Western Eur participants listed (M)

headline.main: W.H.O. Panel Urges Widening Of the Scope of Sex Education

snippet: In an important sex discrimination case, the Supreme Court ruled today that Federal law protects employees from being sexually harassed in the workplace by people of the same sex.     The unanimous decision carried the law of sexual harassment -- ...
lead_paragraph: In an important sex discrimination case, the Supreme Court ruled today that Federal law protects employees from being sexually harassed in the workplace by people of the same sex. The unanimous decision carried the law of sexual harassment -- itself largely a creation of Supreme Court rulings over the last 12 years -- beyond the classic male-female context to a type of case that has only recently been making its way into largely hostile lower courts. Many lower Federal courts either have flatly rejected same-sex harassment claims as a matter or law, or have limited them to cases in which a heterosexual employee complains of harassment by a homosexual co-worker.
abstract: Supreme Court rules that Federal law protects employees from being sexually harassed in workplace by people of same sex; unanimous decision carries law of sexual harassment beyond classic male-female context to type of case that has only recently been making its way into largely hostile lower courts; many lower Federal courts either have rejected same-sex harassment claims as matter of law, or have limited them to cases in which heterosexual employee complains of harassment by homosexual co-worker; decision reinstates harassment suit by oil rig worker Joseph Oncale against his employer, Sundowner Offshore Services Inc, and three members of his all-male crew; Justice Antonin Scalia writes Court's unanimous opinion; photo (M)

headline.main: HIGH COURT WIDENS WORKPLACE CLAIMS IN SEX HARASSMENT

snippet: To the Editor:    Stephen Holden was right in ''Chin Up, Cinderella, There's Still Hope'' [Jan. 26] that the television series ''Sex and the City'' is not a mainstream narrative of women's sexuality, particularly compared with blockbuster Hollywoo...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Stephen Holden was right in ''Chin Up, Cinderella, There's Still Hope'' [Jan. 26] that the television series ''Sex and the City'' is not a mainstream narrative of women's sexuality, particularly compared with blockbuster Hollywood films. Yet I remain unconvinced that the show's agenda is post-feminist. It sits squarely in the feminist tradition in its characters' repudiation of the sexual double standard and its valorization of female friendship.
abstract: Greta Gilbertson letter says TV series Sex and the City is in feminist tradition because its characters repudiate sexual double standard and value female friendship (S)

headline.main: Solidly Feminist

snippet: To the Editor:   In answer to Jane Smiley's question -- how many women vividly recall the day in 1970 when Kate Millett's "Sexual Politics" liberated them from having to fake an interest in Henry Miller? -- I can go one better. Not only did I go t...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: In answer to Jane Smiley's question -- how many women vividly recall the day in 1970 when Kate Millett's "Sexual Politics" liberated them from having to fake an interest in Henry Miller? -- I can go one better. Not only did I go through my bookshelves and dump a lot of male authors (D. H. Lawrence and Freud come to mind) in the garbage, but I stopped reading male authors for 10 years. It is the most liberating gift I have ever given myself. After 40 years of seeing the world -- religion, sex, politics, art, etc. -- through the filter of the male mind, it was thrilling to see it with my own eyes and brain and as women experience it.

headline.main: Sexual Politics

snippet: Four 17-year-old male students at a Roman Catholic high school in Queens were arrested yesterday and charged with having sex with a 15-year-old female classmate last Halloween. The defendants, all seniors, were expelled from Christ the King High S...
lead_paragraph: Four 17-year-old male students at a Roman Catholic high school in Queens were arrested yesterday and charged with having sex with a 15-year-old female classmate last Halloween. The defendants, all seniors, were expelled from Christ the King High School in Middle Village this month. They were charged with sexual misconduct and endangering the welfare of a child, and face up to six months in prison if convicted, said a spokesman for the Queens district attorney, Richard A. Brown. Lawyers for three of the defendants said that rape had not been claimed, but Madeline Bryer, the girl's lawyer, said that the sex was not consensual. An official at the high school declined to comment. Robert F. Worth (NYT)
abstract: Four 17-year-old male students are arrested and charged with having sex with 15-year-old female classmate; boys are expelled from Christ the King High School in Middle Village, Queens (S)

headline.main: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Four Students Arrested In Sex Case

snippet: To the Editor:    Larry Kramer claims (Op-Ed, Dec. 12) that by ''allowing sex-centrism to remain the sole definition of homosexuality,'' we gay men have ''created a culture that in effect murdered us.'' Such assertions are anything but facts. They...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Larry Kramer claims (Op-Ed, Dec. 12) that by ''allowing sex-centrism to remain the sole definition of homosexuality,'' we gay men have ''created a culture that in effect murdered us.'' Such assertions are anything but facts. They give a new life to the homophobia of the early 1980's, which consisted in talking about AIDS as a product of gay men's sexuality.
abstract: Leo Bersani letter disputes Larry Kramer's December 12 Op-Ed article on homosexuality and AIDS (S)

headline.main: In Debate, Gay Men Aim to Find Middle Path; Homophobia Redux

snippet: INHIBITED sexual desire has emerged in the 1980's as the leading sexual disorder and a major underlying factor, if not a direct cause, of many marital breakups. The problem affects single people as well as married couples and those committed to lo...
lead_paragraph: INHIBITED sexual desire has emerged in the 1980's as the leading sexual disorder and a major underlying factor, if not a direct cause, of many marital breakups. The problem affects single people as well as married couples and those committed to long-term relationships. At the same time, therapists say that some people who judge themselves against an imagined societal standard only think there is something wrong with their level of sexual interest. In reality, if neither they nor their partners are dissatisfied, the frequency of sexual relations - be it twice a week or twice a year or never - should not be cause for concern. For a growing number of couples who seek sex therapy, however, one or both partners is unhappy about their low level of sexual interest or lost sexual intimacy.

headline.main: PERSONAL HEALTH

snippet: WHAT makes one person male, another female? Increasingly sophisticated studies indicate  that the answer lies in a complex chain of events that determines one's genital anatomy, reproductive potential and, perhaps, one's sexual identity and behavi...
lead_paragraph: WHAT makes one person male, another female? Increasingly sophisticated studies indicate that the answer lies in a complex chain of events that determines one's genital anatomy, reproductive potential and, perhaps, one's sexual identity and behavior as well.
abstract: Complex prenatal process which determines sexual identity described by Dr John Money; graph; masculinizing hormone mix is required at precise moment in prenatal development to create male from undifferentiated tissue which will otherwise develop female characteristics (M)
